title: Connecting Through Art (APDA x Columbia)
summary: Monthly creative arts group for people impacted by Parkinson’s disease. No experience required; supplies provided. In-person and virtual options.
description: Each month explores a different medium—watercolor, acrylics, weaving, sculpture, collage, and more. The program supports mood, connection, and fine motor/visual-cognitive skills.

location.name: Columbia Community Partnership for Health
location.address: 390 Ft. Washington Ave (between 177th & 178th St), New York, NY

registration.note: Zoom link provided upon registration. Space is limited.

title: Planning Ahead: Disability, Insurance & Resources
summary: Monthly virtual workshop for families affected by neurological illness. Learn about disability applications, transportation options, and insurance coverage.
description: If you’re wondering whether your insurance covers transportation, if you should apply for disability, or how to plan ahead, you are not alone. This monthly workshop, led by a licensed social worker specializing in neurology, covers key resources for families managing neurological illness.

registration.note: Visit our events page for more information.

title: Grief Support Group for Neurological Disease Loss
summary: Biweekly online support group for those who have lost a loved one to a chronic neurological illness. Open to Columbia caregivers.
description: This biweekly group offers support for those grieving the loss of a loved one to a brain cancer or chronic neurological disease like ALS or Parkinson’s. Sessions cover grief-related topics and ways to honor their memory. Participants must commit to at least 6 of 9 sessions.

requirements: Caregivers of those who had a chronic neurological disease treated at Columbia

registration.note: Registration is required. A social worker will contact you after submission.

facilitators: Nicole Ross, LMSW, OSW-C – Neuro-Oncology Social Worker
Linda Golding, MA, BCC – Multifaith Chaplain

title: Speech for PD
summary: Free, online speech classes for people with Parkinson’s and their care partners, led by Dr. Gemma Moya-Galé at Columbia University.
description: Speech for PD is a university- and community-based program offering free online group speech classes to improve communication and social connection for people with Parkinson’s disease. Founded by Dr. Gemma Moya-Galé in 2019 and supported by the Parkinson’s Foundation.

contact.name: Dr. Gemma Moya-Galé
contact.title: PhD, CCC-SLP, Teachers College, Columbia University

values: Speech for PD is an inclusive and diverse community that empowers people with PD and promotes social connection.
goals: Our goal is to improve quality of life through voice strengthening and social communication in a supportive space.
